item.description:
Another idea to ponder.

Let's bike on the Pierre Lallement Bike Path- Jamaica Plain to Bay Bay/South End and find a brunch place to eat. Then we will bike back on the same path to our cars.
http://www.mhd.state.ma.us/default.asp?pgid=../common/downloads/bikemaps/south&sid=about

It's a SMALL LENGTH path (3 mls one way?) but it's summer so why not enjoy it.Â It passes within blocks of the house where the inventor of the pedal bicycle, Pierre Lallement, died in the nineteenth century.

**Park in Jamaica Plain (off street parking). The path runs in back of the Orange Line. It's a popular back road path but not everybody knows about it.

MORE INFO
http://www.mass.gov/dcr/parks/metroboston/southwestCorr.htm

http://www.ltolman.org/93arch/93905.htm

http://www.everytrail.com/guide/pierre-lallement-bike-path

**Remember, post all comments and questions here so everyone can be on the same page (no separate emails)
**Bring your helmet and water
**Rain, hurricane weather cancels

**Please meet at the Upper Birth of the station, there is a Green Line, outside, bus sitting area where the 39 bus makes it last stop. It is right across the street from the path.

BRUNCH @ Darryl's Corner Bar & Kitchen, extra special because it's a jazz brunch with southern and comfort food. This is one price, which is good because we don't have to fuss about how much money to bring, $21.95.

http://www.darrylscornerbarboston.com/
item.name: Bikes n Brunch
